document.heading: Redevelopment Land Agency Disposition Review Act of 1982

history.narrative: Law 4-140, the “Redevelopment Land Agency Disposition Review Act of 1982,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-319, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Economic Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 6, 1982, and May 11, 1982, respectively. Disapproved by the Mayor on June 4, 1982, it was assigned Act No. 4-206 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
